column2: Materials and methods  Patients  Between 2000 and 2008, 82 consecutive patients with inflammatory bowel diseases, familial adenomatous polyposis, or miscellaneous disease, undergoing ileal pouchanal anastomosis under a total laparoscopic approach, were enrolled in this study. Reasons for not attempting laparoscopic approach were: several previous laparotomies (n = 9), rectal or T4 colic cancer (n = 7), and miscellaneous (anesthetic contraindication for laparoscopy, beginning of the experience, redo ileal pouchanal anastomosis, previous partial colectomy, etc.).
